alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 7:43AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: .An atmospheric river has brought widespread heavy rainfall across Southeast Alaska. Heavy rainfall rates Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning have resulted in river rises across the Mendenhall Valley. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Jordan Creek, Montana Creek, Auke Lake near Mendenhall Valley Area. * WHEN...Until 900 PM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Significant runoff from heavy rain is causing minor flooding of creeks and streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 733 AM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain around the Mendenhall Valley Area. Minor flooding is ongoing around Jordan Creek and water levels are high around Auke Lake and Montana Creek, but are still within their banks. Auke Lake and Jordan Creek are still rising as of 7 am. Between 1.5 to 3 inches of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible through the afternoon hours. - For Auke Lake near Auke Bay: At 7:00am the stage was 32.5 feet and rising. Flood Stage is 33.0 feet. Forecast: Water levels are expected to crest around 33.8 ft around mid day today. Impacts: At 32.0 feet: This is bankful conditions along Auke Lake. At 33.0 feet: Water from the lake will inundate yards of homes along Auke Lake. - For Jordan Creek near Juneau: At 7:00am the stage was 10.0 feet and rising. Flood Stage is 9.7 feet. Forecast:Water levels should crest this afternoon around 10.3 ft. Impacts: At 9.2 feet: This is the stage when Jordan Creek is at bankfull and water will begin to inundate areas along the edges of the creek near Race Reality and Jordan Square. At 9.7 feet: Water will inundate the Jordan Square`s front and back parking lots, around Jordan Creek office condominiums with up to one foot of water. Some residential driveways will be flooded and cut off. - For Montana Creek at Back Loop Bridge: At 7:00am the stage was 14.1 feet and falling. Flood Stage is 14.5 feet. Forecast: Water levels will stay high but are expected to remain within there banks at this time. Impacts: At 14.5 feet: Water begins flowing over the low water crossing on Montana Creek Road. Bankfull conditions at the gauge with water starting to inundate adjacent undeveloped fields along Mendenhall Loop Road.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
